The percent of the sample not directly counted. In the case of a large sample that requires subsampling, this is an indication of how much of the sample was counted to estimate community composition. For example, if the mosquitoes were divided into 5 equal piles and only one pile was counted to estimate total abundance and diversity, the percent not counted would be 80%. For smaller samples (e.g., <200 individuals), the entire sample is counted and the percent not counted would be 0%

1- Litter collected - Trap in good shape, no issues; 2 - Litter not collected - Holes large enough for leaves to pass through.; 3 - Litter not collected _ trap blocked. Large branches or leaves (especially palm fronds) present in the trap which may have prevented trap from collecting litter or diverted falling litter away from the trap; 4 - Litter not collected _ trap tilted ? 10; 5 - Litter not collected _ trap broken, requires replacement
type of litter trap from which a sample was collected, Elevated, Ground
dry weight of twigs; grams
Average height of the understory vegetation in a plot, assessed by visual survey to guide LAI photo collection

Unique identifier associated with each sample vial per sampleID. Current format consists of the sampleID and a sequential number for each vial associated with that sampleID

The USGS standard definition: the 12-month period October 1, for any given year through September 30, of the following year. The water year is designated by the calendar year in which it ends and which includes 9 of the 12 months
The end date for the breeding bird sampling window for a site, based on expert knowledge or historical data; not equivalent to the last date that sampling took place
The start date for the breeding bird sampling window for a site, based on expert knowledge or historical data; not equivalent to the first date that sampling took place
